meanings.definition: To destroy completely; to wipe out.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight eradicated the dragon from the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The scientists worked hard to eradicate the deadly virus.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to eradicate all the burnt cookies from the batch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could eradicate any trace of sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The powerful storm eradicated the fragile sandcastle in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The new medicine was able to eradicate the illness from the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The detective was determined to eradicate all evidence of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to eradicate the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: His apology could not fully eradicate the hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The janitor worked tirelessly to eradicate every speck of dust in the room.

meanings.definition: To get rid of something completely.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to eradicate all traces of the old paint from the walls.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to eradicate the outdated policies for good.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics seemed to eradicate the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays slowly eradicated the morning dew from the grass.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used special tools to eradicate the stubborn weeds from the garden.
